result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan R. McNeely

defendant.name: McNeely, Jordan R.
defendant.address: S9922 Exchange Road, Prairie du Sac, WI 53578

records.addlTxt:
11:30 a.m.  Defendant Jordan R. McNeely in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric James Caudill in court for Atty Avena and for Jordan R. McNeely.  Court states cases and appearances.  State notes victim rights have been complied with.  Court makes record re: competency order filed in this case and the ordered treatment that didn't occur due to a waiting list.  Jail-based comp info has recently been filed.  Dr. Jackson info filed - parties are not objecting to find made that DE is now competent to proceed.  Order for competency is no longer necessary and DE is now released from competency evaluation and as DE has signed a signature bond in 22CM117 and cash posted in 22CF160 the DE can be released from custody.  All bonds conditions would continue.  Court reminds DE of those bond conditions as to no contact provisions.  DE states he understands.  Atty Caudill requests new RD in 22CM117 and in 22CF160 they are requesting a PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 31, 2022 at 08:10 am.

12:58 PM Defendant Jordan R. McNeely in court, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Jordan R. McNeely.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  Both counsel received a copy of the report.  Atty Avena does not contest any of the findings in the report.  Court  finds DE not competent and directs that he be admitted to a State Mental Hospital.  Court will schedule an internal review for 3 months for an update.  Sauk Co. Sheriff's Dept. to transport DE once there is ad admission date.
Competency hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan R. McNeely in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill o/b/o Glenn Edward Avena in court for Jordan R. McNeely.  Court notes Atty Avena raised competency and an evaluation be completed.  The evaluation has been completed noting DE refused to participate and recommendation is for DE to be taken into custody for inpatient competency evaluation.  State agrees with inpatient.  Atty Caudill agrees.  Court directs DE be taken into custody subject to an in patient evaluation order.  Court notes a victim was present but given today's hearing, there was no place for a victim to speak.
Return date on May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:00 AM Defendant Jordan R. McNeely in court with attorney Glenn Edward Avena.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Avena raises competency at this time and requests the Court order a competency evaluation be completed.  Atty Avena waives times limits on behalf of DE.  Court directs a competency evaluation be ordered.  Atty Avena provides an alternative phone number for DE's mother.  Return date scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

May not be within 100 feet of the property that is owned by the S.B.G./J.M.G. on Block Road nor can he be on Block Road between Church Street and Exchange Road, in Prairie du Sac, WI.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:29 PM Defendant Jordan R. McNeely by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Kathryn E Hayes by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Jordan R. McNeely in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  S.G. by Zoom audio and video and makes statement.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $15,000 cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends a signature bond.  $5,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with S.B.G. or J.M.G., their residence or their place of employment.  Comply with terms and conditions in the injunctions in 22CV76 and 22CV75.  May not be within 100 feet of the property that is owned by the S.B.G./J.M.G. on Block Road nor can he be on Block Road between Church Street and Exchange Road, in Prairie du Sac, WI.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
